com.apigee.flow.execution.spi

Interface Execution


  • public interface Execution

    The Execution interface has a single method that you must implement: execute(MessageContext messageContext, ExecutionContext executionContext). The MessageContext object gives you access to these entities:

    • The request and response message - Get, set, remove query parameters, headers, and message content.
    • Flow variables (For details on flow variables, see the Variables reference.)
  • The ExecutionContext gives you some control over the execution flow of your Java code.

  • Example: Simple implementation with error handling and debugging techniques

    public class JavaError implements Execution {

    public ExecutionResult execute(MessageContext messageContext, ExecutionContext executionContext) {

        try {

            String name = messageContext.getMessage().getHeader("username");

            if (name != null && name.length() > 0) {
                messageContext.getMessage().setContent("Hello, " + name + "!");
                messageContext.getMessage().removeHeader("username");

            } else {
                throw new RuntimeException("Please specify a name parameter!");
            }

            return ExecutionResult.SUCCESS;

        } catch (RuntimeException ex) {
            ExecutionResult executionResult = new ExecutionResult(false, Action.ABORT);

            //--Returns custom error message and header
            executionResult.setErrorResponse(ex.getMessage());
            executionResult.addErrorResponseHeader("ExceptionClass", ex.getClass().getName());

            //--Sets a flow variable -- may be useful for debugging. 
            messageContext.setVariable("JAVA_ERROR", ex.getMessage());
            messageContext.setVariable("JAVA_STACKTRACE", ExceptionUtils.getStackTrace(ex));

            return executionResult;
        }
    }
}

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor and Description
    Execution() 
    Default constructor.
    Execution(Map<string,string> properties) 
    Access properties set in the callout policy.

  • Method Summary

    All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
    Modifier and Type Method and Description
    ExecutionResult execute(MessageContext messageContext, ExecutionContext executionContext) 
    The method where you place your custom Java callout code. Provides access to the message and execution contexts.

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        ExecutionResult execute(MessageContext messageContext,
                        ExecutionContext executionContext)
        Parameters:
        messageContext - The context object associated with the current proxy flow.
        executionContext - The context object of the current execution. Lets you control some aspects of the execution of your Java code.
        Returns:
        Returns ExecutionResult.SUCCESS if no errors occur. On error, you can construct and return a new ExecutionResult object and set custom error messages and headers on it.
